About The Team

Brian Boyer

Brian Boyer is NPR's news applications editor. He came to NPR from the Chicago Tribune, where he led a similar team of data journalists, designers and developers who built news applications and editorial tools. He loves his job. Find him on Twitter as @brianboyer or send email to bboyer@npr.org.

Jeremy Bowers

Jeremy Bowers is a news applications developer. Before NPR, Jeremy worked for The Washington Post and the (former) St. Petersburg Times. Jeremy loves baseball, barbecue, his wife @beckybowers and his lovely daughter, #TheSqueezle. Find him on Twitter as @jeremybowers or send email to jbowers@npr.org.

Stephanie d'Otreppe

Stephanie d'Otreppe is an interactive designer with NPR's news applications team. Prior to working at NPR, she was a designer in the PR and marketing word. She holds a B.A. in Public Communications from American University and a certificate in Graphic and Web design from Boston University. When not working, she enjoys photography, exploring the DC food and music scenes, and volunteering with Lucky Dog Animal Rescue. She lives in Washington, DC with her boyfriend and the occasional fostered pup. Find her on Twitter as @petitchoudc or email her at sdotreppe@npr.org.

Christopher Groskopf

Christopher Groskopf is a news applications developer at NPR. Before joining NPR he was lead developer on the PANDA Project and a member of the Chicago Tribune News Applications team. He is the maintainer of several open source projects, including Hack Tyler and csvkit. He lives in Tyler, TX with his son and listens to his coding music at unreasonable volumes. Find him on Twitter as @onyxfish or send email to cgroskopf@npr.org.

Alyson Hurt

Alyson Hurt is a senior interactive designer with NPR's news applications team, working on infographics, interactives and special news presentations. She previously worked at washingtonpost.com and azcentral.com. She holds an M.A. in Communication, Culture and Technology from Georgetown University and a B.A. in Journalism from Arizona State University. Outside of work, she enjoys letterpress and bicycling. She lives in Arlington, Va., with her husband Rob and their two rabbits, Milo and Lily. Find her on Twitter as @alykat or send email to ahurt@npr.org

Matt Stiles

Matt Stiles is the team's data editor. He previously was the database reporting coordinator for NPR's StateImpact project. Before joining NPR, Stiles worked as a reporter and data applications editor at The Texas Tribune, a digital news startup in Austin. He has also covered politics and law enforcement at The Dallas Morning News and the Houston Chronicle. Find him on Twitter at @stiles or send email to mstiles@npr.org.
